Articles.Content:
ok its uploaded to github. haven't tested pma. too tired now... 3am.

also I made it so destiny has inbuilt docks at each end and of course at the side for S0. 

but atleast I got a few things fixed...

more tomorrow

oh and I added the nodes to quest and columbus

Thank you, Sir. I very much appreciate it.

I'll test this afternoon (11:20 here in the eastern US).

so that inbuild dock on the bottom of z1 will connect to another dock from another module.

inbuild dock ontop of z1 should dock straight to a truss (they have inbuilt docks)

have only got as far as s1 for now.

night.
Sleep well!

Well, that was strange.

I launched and docked Destiny with no problems. I detached the destroyed the launch vehicle debris.

Then I launched the Quest. Docked fine, detached and destroyed the launch vehicle debris, then switched back to the station.

And then everything went black.

I switched back to the space center view... and Kerbin is GONE!

Back to square one, I guess...
Kerbin was going the moment i launched the whole station.... guess it's not me....
Oh, you have the missing Kerbin bug, too? I did also notice that, when I docked Quest, it reset the time on orbit for the station.
Well, I guess it's time for round two of my favorite game "Fine the Glitch"
Then I shall wait for your results before restarting construction.

Looks like it might be a problem with Rassvet. built iss in the sph one piece at a time, launching it to the runway after each piece.... no problem until i added rassvet. next ill try launching just rassvet as a test.. will report back with results

Update:

Yep, its rassvet. Launched just rassvet and kerbin ran away....

Strange. Mine was fine with Rassvet. It was only after docking Quest that mine went away.

Let me load up and check...

EDIT: You're absolutely right. Let me check Quest alone...

Hmm... I guess I have to COMPLETELY quit out of KSP. Deleting and starting a new game doesn't bring the planet back.

SECOND EDIT: Did you reapply the Soviet Pack Compatibility Patch? I didn't, and that might be what caused it.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-09T18:18:42Z" title="08/09/2015 06:18  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 9, 2015</time> by AdmiralSirJohn**

I can confirm it is rassvet, at least for me. I launched ISS without rassvet and had no problem.

- - - Updated - - -

Yeah, i had to quit and reload to bring kerbin back

- - - Updated - - -

Yeah, I think i did.... let me recheck

Nope. That was definitely not it. Let me try with MIR's version...

UPDATE: The MIR (Orange) version works properly. The ISS (White) version causes the glitch.

BTW, how do I get that - - - Updated - - - tag to show?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-09T18:33:54Z" title="08/09/2015 06:33  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 9, 2015</time> by AdmiralSirJohn**

Cool, good to know we found the glitch. I'm checking right now to see if the mir-port dokcing glitch is fixed or not. I'll report back in a few moments with my results.

- - - Updated - - -

reply to your own most recent post

Okay.

There may be a companion glitch in Quest. I tried your "build in SPH and launch from runway" test with it, and it immediately acted like it was in time acceleration, even though it wasn't. (Jiggles, animation locked, etc.)

- - - Updated - - -

As for the Rassvet/MIR Port, that has me stumped, since they use the same model. Only the texturing is different.

- - - Updated - - -

Though I did notice that Rassvet loads up crewed, while the MIR Port version loads empty (though the seats are there).

Probably a difference in the config file

- - - Updated - - -

It appears the mir-port docking bug is still present. With the full station in orbit, I cant dock to the aft of zvesda, but when i launch a station without the truss segments, i can dock to the aft of zvesda without a problem.

That's strange. Of course, I'm doing individual launches, using the sequence from Wikipedia. (I'm using the Krystal module as stand in for Nauka.)

Which reminds me, any plans for the Bigelow inflatable modules?

Again it appears the bug is caused by a part in the truss. I will try to narrow it down to a specific part, but the testing will have to wait a bit.

- - - Updated - - -

I would like to see the bigelow module as well as the IDA
Okay, I've begun testing individual truss components.... So far I can confirm the problem is not S0

I found another problem. The Pirs/Poisk decoupler will not attach to the Soyuz/Progress service module. However, they will attach directly to the Soyuz decoupler, so it's still launchable that way.

- - - Updated - - -

Could it be P/S3/4 or P/S6? There may be something about the solar panels or rotation that screw things up.

I just finished more testing, it appears the problem is the solar arrays themselves. I launched ISS with everything but the solar arrays themselves, and i could dock with no problem. then i built a tiny little probe, docked with it no problem, then relaunched the same probe, this time with the solar array, and i couldn't dock to it. The problem is the ISS Solar Arrays

- - - Updated - - -

I found something else. I put the whole station in orbit, then launched my two docking test probes and put them within 200m of station, and i couldnt dock them. Which means one of two things things: the glitch with the solar arrays prevents docking within the 200m sphere, or the lag caused by the solar arrays prevents docking. either way, it seems to be the solar arrays causing the problem.

Have you tried it in the 11-30-2000 configuration (P6 and solar arrays docked to the top of the Z1 - as seen in [this image](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7c/Sts097-704-074.jpg/894px-Sts097-704-074.jpg))?

I'll try that right now

- - - Updated - - -

tried it, couldn't dock. I'll try it again without the solar arrays. I'll keep p6, ill just take off the solars.

- - - Updated - - -

tried it without solars, but kept p6. docked just fine. The solars are the only thing that changed... to be clear, I'm talking about the ISS Truss S3/SP Sail solar arrays

- - - Updated - - -

I've been testing all this in RSS, so I'm going to jump over to stock and test it again to see if it's any different.

- - - Updated - - -

tried the same test in stock: without Solar Sail I can dock, with it I can't. Simple as that.

Definitely the solar panels, then.

Also, the standard radiator won't deploy.
I know, I used the stock medium radiators instead. they look exactly the same... Or at least close enough
